movieReview: This is still rehashed crap. My in-laws wanted to watch it, and everyone basically came to the same conclusion.
Happy New Year!
Happy New Year, cont.
An adequate telling of a classic fable. White washing all around though

movieTitle: J.R. 'Bob' Dobbs and the Church of the SubGenius
movieReview: This was a good doc on the Church of the SubGenius, one of the better Kickstarter doc backings I've had.
In a nightmare scenario the copy of John Wick 3 I brought was fucked up, so we had to bail out like 15m in and watch something else. Luckily we had bought this movie, Serenity, for Rita's Birthday.
Happy Mew Year part 3
Seemed appropriate
Not great, but an ok sci-fi thriller
Not exactly sure why I watched this again, but it was still ok.
Solid! It’s been awhile since I saw a horror movie I actually enjoyed!
It had been awhile since I had seen this. It still holds up.
This was very good.

movieTitle: The Girl with All the Gifts
movieReview: This was a fantastic, original one!
Heartbreaking
I’m glad I watched this. It is an amateur film but it has heart and is so much better than others of its ilk
This was still a fun ride, still mostly nonsense, and I still don't understand why Nolan isn't interested in us understanding his actors.

movieTitle: ZZ Top: That Little Ol' Band from Texas
movieReview: Watched this on a lark, solid rock doc.
Far better than I expected! A bit of “going back to the well” but stood enough on its own
Guh.
Ok, but would have been better as a short imho

movieTitle: Billie Eilish: The World's a Little Blurry
movieReview: A wild ride as Billie broke big. Great doc.

i don't know why I watched this. It sucks, but differently from the original theatrical release. It's twice as long, but most of that seems to be due to so. many. slow. motion. sequences. do not recommend.
Exactly what you’d expect
A stark reminder of the start of this pandemic.
Kinda glad I saw this after UNCUT GEMS... It was a better film, but had the similar 'on edge' vibe that worked less for me in the later film. RPatz continues to kill it.
Exactly what was written on the box and just what the doctor ordered. Good fun.
Very good. Intense and infuriating.

movieTitle: Summer of Soul (...Or, When the Revolution Could Not Be Televised)
movieReview: An amazing first feature doc from Questlove. I was completely ignorant of the festival so it was not only great to see all those wonderful performances but to also have the interviews with artists and attendees so deftly cut into it.
A powerful film trying to shed some light on the massive racism in the progressive bastion of Boston.

movieTitle: The Dog Who Wouldn't Be Quiet
movieReview:
Full disclosure: I watched this on my phone on the ride back from VA, so i didn't *really* watch it. 

This was OK, it took me awhile to figure out what was going on, but it was a weird slice of life film that takes a surprising turn...

movieTitle: We're All Going to the World's Fair
movieReview: I wanted to like this, but it ultimately didn't quite work for me. It never quite gelled. There were some good ideas in there, though.
This was fine, but I kinda think i’m over rust belt/Appalachian misery porn.
Very good doc about police in schools and the inherent racism of many of our policies and practices.

movieTitle: Who We Are: A Chronicle of Racism in America
movieReview: A Riveting, cogent and straightforward case for the inherent racism in this country, from it’s founding until today.
This didn’t click for me for some reason….. I just found myself watching the clock and being distracted.
After a pretty cruddy week this fairly simple, straightforward movie was a wonderful tonic. It’s fairly by the numbers but the numbers are pretty good.
This was not what I expected at all and I’m glad! This was great!
A fairly straightforward doc about this subject, somewhat narrowly focused (in a good way), but I would have preferred that it come after the trial.
Edgar Wright’s loving look at one of the best weirdo bands of all time.
This was a sweet, little movie… Nothing flashy, but enjoyable.
This did not work for me.

movieTitle: Poly Styrene: I Am a Cliché
movieReview: This was a very moving look into the life of one of the punk greats.
Powerful documentary, but it could have used some light narration or contextualization from time to time.
This was ok, not bad, but it never quite gelled for me…
This was gut wrenching. I’m not sure I enjoyed it.
A surprising and interesting look at two fields that overlap more than expected at first blush.
The subject matter was important but I also don’t like kids.

I did not like this. The dialogue was bad and while the main actors
All did fine, the child and supporting actors were all bad.
Solid doc about the gig economy and it’s victims
Powerful.
Exactly the bit of light fun I needed to cap off IFFBoston 2021. A quarantine movie but not a quarantine movie. An apocalypse movie but not an apocalypse movie. Very good.
I heard a few bad reviews of this movie, saying it fell apart at the end, but I wholly disagree. This was quite good, and I’m honestly at a loss as to why people would feel that way.
I understand this is a big dumb monster movie. But even with that knowledge this was really dumb.
First time back in the theater. Unfortunately this was kind of a dud. The dialogue was terrible and overall it needed more momentum.
Needed a statham classic to wash away the turd of WRATH OF MAN
It was great to see Bo again, and this was, by far, one of the better quarantine productions i’ve seen.
By far the best DCEU Snyderverse film. This was actually enjoyable! And Fun!
This was far more fun than the prior one. Hoped they stop here tho
Fun doc which made great use of the unreliable narrator.
Watched this again crashing at my sisters house as her internet was down and she had it on the shelf. Still fun enough

Another bland Marvel action film. It was fine, but nothing particularly special. And it would have been too little, too late when it was SUPPOSED to be released a year+ ago... It's like Marvel woke up in a cold sweat realizing it didn't have any female solo films.
I think whatever your expectations are of the new Nic Cage film PIG are, you will be surprised. It was so great being back in a theatre with a crowd!
Solid doc on Boston royalty.
Still a turd.
This was better than 8 by a mile, but the entire series is getting dumber and dumber. the 5th movie is still the high water mark by far
So many delusional people...

movieTitle: Roadrunner: A Film About Anthony Bourdain
movieReview: This was nice, though I wish it had a bit more early biography (pre-author) and a bit less "last two years" dwelling... Obviously you need SOME of that given the story, but I could have used less.
Watched this with the McWeavers. Pure joy.
The Mrs. wanted to watch this again, and who am I to argue. It was still solid.
Pretty fun but too long.

I listened to the Dune audiobook, having never read the book nor did I really remember this movie. The movie is OK as a movie but bad as a dune adaptation I think it’s just tried to cram too much material into too little time
This was fine. Had some funny moments. Will forget it existed in a few months.
This was a story I knew nothing about…. It wasn’t an amazing doc, but it kept my attention
This was a weird surprise. I enjoyed it
Not sure which I hate more, pyramid schemes or hedge fund dicks

movieTitle: Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings
movieReview: pretty generic marvel movie. Fuckers can’t help but have a swarm of faceless enemies flying around at the end.

movieTitle: Skin Deep: The Battle Over Morgellons
movieReview: This has always felt to me like some set of real conditions setting off a host of psychosomatic responses. I’m not sure this movie changed my mind much.

movieTitle: Bitchin': The Sound and Fury of Rick James
movieReview: Solid roc doc, prolly could have shed 15m
I was sick and I went on a music doc binge…. This drumming doc was very good.
Dave “Rock Dad” Grohl may show up everywhere but there’s a reason. He’s a good storyteller as well as charming.

Watched this again while convalescing, but after I had read the first two books of Dune (which I had never read the prior time I saw this). This movie would have been bananas but I’m uncertain if it actually would have been Dune. Would have been a bigger swing than Lynch’s version, tho

This was a very contemporary documentary about Britney’s battle to end her conservatorship, covering up until a few months ago (and with coda text going up to last month). It had some interesting interviews, but definitely felt a little too “outside”.
This was fine, but tried a little too hard to be a Sopranos prequel.
I was not expecting an anthology film but that is more or less what it was. A few of the vignettes were great and the others were fine.
Fantastic. Would have sat in my seat for another 2h to see the whole first book. Can't wait for the continuation.
A fun comedy special with some documentary blended in as well. Bobcat and Dana are always funny.
This surprised me, as I went in completely ignorant. But it moved quickly, was clever, beautiful, and enjoyable.
I love Todd Haynes and was relatively ignorant of TVU so this was a match made in heaven.
A Bond-assed Bond film. Solid, fun... Possibly the most "Classic Bond" of the Craig films w/o becoming overly campy or ridiculous.
A solid update of the original
This was fine.
A good doc about a fucking huge album

Corinna had never seen this, and we were looking for something fun to bridge the holiday gap, so here we are, diving into the entire Friday the 13th series.

The first one still holds up reasonably well.

This one is kinda baffling, they needed to figure out a hook to get back into the story, and so.... Another summer camp but not OUR summer camp but it's a summer camp on the same lake and.... I mean it's fine as a dumb slasher movie but it's pretty dumb.
This was a profound turd, but at least Jason got his mask

So, like, this was not good, but it was much better than Part 3. The filmmakers seemed to A) remember that we need some characters to moor to, such as Tommy Jarvis and B) are probably not going to buy another summer camp story.
Completely fascinating.
I was mostly on board with this mediocrity until the end when they couldn't help themselves from bringing a CG Harold Ramis into the mix. Then I was just pissed off.
This was not great, but fine.

movieTitle: Friday the 13th Part VI: Jason Lives
movieReview: This was, by far, the worst of the bunch so far. It was hokey and didn't take itself seriously, but in the bad way. Hopefully this is the low water mark.

movieTitle: Tom Petty - Somewhere You Feel Free
movieReview: I always loved this album, and getting a peek behind the curtain felt very special.

movieTitle: Friday the 13th Part VII: The New Blood
movieReview: These are getting progressively worse...

movieTitle: Friday the 13th Part VIII: Jason Takes Manhattan
movieReview: Holy shit this was pretty bad....

movieTitle: Jason Goes to Hell: The Final Friday
movieReview: This series hasn't had the best regard for canon, but to just make a bunch of shit up for the "last" episode is pretty dumb...

Without a doubt, this was the best Friday movie. It had some fun and pasted over Jason's complete lack of identity beyond being a hulking murder machine by adding actual other characters with goals and motivations. Granted, those characters were also fairly thin, but at least they were there!

Instead of jumping into Freddy vs. Jason or the Friday remake, we decided to go back and watch the Nightmare movies first. And boy after two weeks of Friday movies this was a breath of fresh air. Nightmare on Elm Street is SO much better than any Jason movie by orders of magnitude.

movieTitle: A Nightmare on Elm Street Part 2: Freddy's Revenge
movieReview: This was a turd. There's no other way to put it. The filmmakers didn't even seem to understand Freddy's whole schtick: operating in the dream world.

movieTitle: A Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors
movieReview: My memory was that this was the best “Nightmare” movie and it did not disappoint. We’ll see how the remainder of films and up, but this one is great.

movieTitle: A Nightmare on Elm Street 4: The Dream Master
movieReview: This was OK.... Easy to be a letdown after Dream Warriors.
Can’t say I love Kenny g. But this is a very good doc and I wouldn’t shit on him even tho it’s not my bag.
Wouldn’t be a Christmas without the legend
Probably the all-time best.
It had been awhile since we revisited this one and it is still hilarious.

movieTitle: A Nightmare on Elm Street 5: The Dream Child
movieReview: The further past #3 we get, the more the returns are diminishing.... Still better than every Friday the 13th save Jason X.
No two ways about it, this is a total turd.
Still great. Can’t wait for the second part.
This was fun, watched it on my laptop, look forward to watching it again at home on my soundsystem.
Better than any of the other Matrix sequels. A little too memberberries, of course, but in an intentionally meta way

movieTitle: A Good Day to Die Hard
movieReview: I had avoided this because it looked bad. It was worse than I expected.

I can't remember the last time I saw this, it feels like forever ago... The inlaws mentioned they watch it every year, so I figured why not. Still a perfectly fine movie, Cameron definitely knows how to make a blockbuster... Not sure how 4 more movies are going to follow, though.
